title: How to Install a Network Interface Card

steps.title: Open the PC case.
steps.content: Open the PC case. The power should be off when you do this.

steps.title: Ensure that you have an antistatic wrist strap attached to your wrist and grounded to the PC when working with it.
steps.content: Ensure that you have an antistatic wrist strap attached to your wrist and grounded to the PC when working with it.

steps.title: Remove the strap before you switch on the power.
steps.content: Remove the strap before you switch on the power.

steps.title: Now take the NIC card and install it into one of the PCI slots by aligning the guide notches with the PCI slot.
steps.content: Now take the NIC card and install it into one of the PCI slots by aligning the guide notches with the PCI slot.

steps.title: Press straight down with gentle pressure until the card snugly fits into the PCI slot.
steps.content: Press straight down with gentle pressure until the card snugly fits into the PCI slot.

steps.title: Secure the card with a single screw used to attach the card to the PC.
steps.content: Secure the card with a single screw used to attach the card to the PC.

steps.title: Check the card whether it moves from its position.
steps.content: Check the card whether it moves from its position. If it does, it could damage itself when the PC is turned on.

steps.title: Close the PC case and turn on the power.
steps.content: Close the PC case and turn on the power.

steps.title: Check if the internet works or not.
steps.content: Check if the internet works or not. If not then check the connections and repeat the above steps.
